sub_tasks.requirements: Patient Cohort Construction
Filters for female patients using `p.gender = 'F'`.
Filters for patients aged 76 to 86 at the time of admission using the calculated age `(p.anchor_age + EXTRACT(YEAR FROM a.admittime) - p.anchor_year) BETWEEN 76 AND 86`.
Correctly identifies inpatient stays by using the `admissions` table as the base for the cohort.
Filters for admissions with a pneumonia diagnosis by correctly joining with the `pneumonia_admissions` CTE on `hadm_id`.
Medical Concept Implementation
Correctly identifies pneumonia diagnoses using both ICD-9 and ICD-10 codes with appropriate version filtering.
Selects correct ICD-9 codes for pneumonia (e.g., '480'-'486').
Selects correct ICD-10 codes for pneumonia (e.g., 'J12'-'J18').
Correctly calculates medication complexity as the count of unique drugs using `COUNT(DISTINCT pr.drug)`.
Restricts medication complexity calculation to the first 7 days of the hospital admission using a `DATETIME_ADD` interval.
Database Integration
Correctly joins `admissions` and `patients` tables on `subject_id` to link demographic data.
Correctly joins cohort data with the `prescriptions` table on `hadm_id`. A LEFT JOIN is appropriately used to retain patients with no medications.
Correctly integrates the 30-day readmission flag by joining the `readmissions_flag` CTE back to the main cohort on `hadm_id`.
Clinical Analytics
Correctly calculates the 30-day readmission flag using a window function (`LEAD`) partitioned by `subject_id` and ordered by admission time.
Correctly calculates Length of Stay (LOS), in-hospital mortality, and handles nulls for complexity/readmission with COALESCE.
Correctly stratifies admissions into three groups (tertiles) based on medication complexity score using `NTILE(3) OVER (ORDER BY med_complexity_score)`.
Correctly groups results by `complexity_tertile` and reports all required metrics: admission count, min/avg/max complexity, avg LOS, mortality %, and readmission %.
